description.p: The problem is that the entity Property_value_representation does not declare the attribute items, therefore the USEDIN will not return a BAG OF Property_representation_item, but a BAG OF GENERIC.

What you need to do is modify the rule to get the correct reference to the items attribute (declared in representation) then constrain the type down to property_value_representations. Also the entity Property_value_representation does not have an attribute units, you should access this through the context_of_items attribute which is of type numerical_representation_context, which has the units attibute!

description.p: Qualified_property_value_representation refers to Unit through both Numerical_item_with_unit and Numerical_representation_context. Though the two references to units are related, no rule seems to control their correct population.
Add a rule to Qualified_property_value_representation to control the correct use of Unit.

comment.description: The use of Numerical_representation_context is only intended to provide a default unit. Its use is not intended to prevent representation_items being secified with the same or different units to the context. Add a note explaining this. The unit specified with the Numerical_item_with_unit supersedes the unit associated with the context.
Added note to this and foundation representation arm.
